settings.name: Upper speed bound for 'stationary' behaviour
settings.description: Insert the upper speed cutoff (in km/h) for behaviour to be classified as 'stationary'.

settings.name: Sunrise leeway (minutes):
settings.description: This is the number of minutes before/after sunrise that 'daytime' is considered to begin. (Negative numbers, e.g. -5 minutes, move this window before sunrise; positive numbers move it after).

settings.name: Sunset leeway (minutes):
settings.description: This is the number of minutes before/after sunset that 'night-time' is considered to begin. (Negative numbers, e.g. -5 minutes, move this window before sunset; positive numbers move it after).

settings.name: Altitude change threshold (metres):
settings.description: This is the absolute change in altitude between consecutive locations beyond which a bird is considered as ascending/descending. For example, setting this to 25 means that the bird is ascending when its change in altitude is above 25m, and descending when below -25m. This setting is only used if column `altitude` is present in the input data.

settings.name: Create summary plots
settings.description: Check this to generate, as artefacts, simple location plots of each bird's behaviourally-classified movements

settings.name: Keep all generated columns:
settings.description: Select this to keep all generated columns. This stores all data used within the classification outputs within the output. We recommend that this is only selected for debugging.
